screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .appxmanifest file in Microsoft Visual Studio 2017
screenshot.caption: APPXMANIFEST file open in Microsoft Visual Studio 2017

description: APPXMANIFEST files are created by Visual Studio, Microsoft's official IDE for building Windows 10 apps. When a developer creates a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app, Visual Studio automatically generates a file named Package.appxmanifest . Developers can open the file in a visual editor and specify the app settings.

When packaging an app, Visual Studio digitally signs the package manifest and prepares an app package for release to users. Various output package types include .APPX , .MSIX , .APPXBUNDLE , .MSIXBUNDLE , .APPXUPLOAD , and .MSIXUPLOAD .

common_filenames.description: Package.appxmanifest - An XML file for a Windows 10 app that describes application properties and settings.
